helpticket.title: Change my email
helpticket.body: In order to change your email please submit a ticket. Our support team will approve the request and make the desired changes.

helpticket.title: Help with a claim
helpticket.body: Our customer support team can help you with a claim. Please specify the claim id and the problem when submitting a ticket.

helpticket.title: Change my demographics
helpticket.body: Our customer support team can help you change your demographics. Please specify the desired changes when submitting a ticket.

helpticket.title: RX Vacation Request Form
helpticket.body: Our customer support team can help you with your Vacation Prescription Request. Please complete and upload the form when submitting your ticket.

helpticket.title: HIPAA Authorized Representative
helpticket.body: Our customer support team can help you update your HIPAA authorized representatives. Please complete and upload the form when submitting your ticket.

helpticket.title: Other insurance company information
helpticket.body: Our customer support team can help update your policy if you have another insurance carrier. Please complete and upload the form, including a copy of the front and back of the other insurance company’s ID card when submitting your ticket.

helpticket.title: Order Member ID Card
helpticket.body: Our customer support team can help you order new member ID card.

partners.name: Optum Live and Work Well
partners.description: Optum® is a recognized leader specializing in provider behavioral health care and substance use disorder services and provides our mental health and substance use benefits. With Optum®, members have access to over 203,000 in-network clinicians and 3,000 in-network facilities in more than 6,300 locations nationwide. These In-Network providers are easy to locate 24 hours-a-day, 7 days-a-week by either using our online provider locator or by calling Optum’s toll free number at 877-468-1016.

partners.name: CVS CareMark
partners.description: Our pharmacy benefit manager, CVS Caremark®, is a leader in the healthcare industry. The NALC CareSelect Network is a large nationwide network that offers more than 68,000 retail pharmacies. The NALC CareSelect Network includes most large retail chain drug stores. Through the CVS website, you can locate a network pharmacy, reorder prescription medication, and access the prescription drug cost calculator.

partners.name: AmWell
partners.description: NALCHBP Telehealth makes it easy to virtually connect to physicians using the AmWell network of providers. All physicians are U.S. trained and board certified and available to help with your urgent care needs 24-hours a day, 7-days a week.

partners.name: Cigna
partners.description: The Cigna HealthCare Shared Administration OAP network for the NALC Health Benefit Plan has over 23,000 participating facilities, 3.4 million family doctors and specialists, 9,435 general acute care hospitals and 170 transplant facilities. This network is accredited by the National Committee of Quality Assurance (NCQA) assuring you a choice of quality health care providers who meet all of Cigna’s rigorous credentialing standards. Choosing to use providers in the network means lower out of pocket costs for you and your family. Cigna also provides many important wellness programs for our members such as Healthy Rewards, Healthy Pregnancies, Healthy Babies, a 24-hour Health Information Line, and a disease management program. The CDHP and Value Option Plans are administered by Cigna Healthcare.

datatransferattestation.legal_attestation:
To assume that individuals are properly informed of their rights and risks in connection with the disclosure of their personal health information, this Attestation meets the standards described by the United States Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Interoperability and Patient Access final rule (CMS-9115-F) in the Federal Register.

To ensure appropriate access to personal health information, The customer is requesting that all Health Data Transfer Users attest to the statements below (hereinafter referred to as the “Attestation”) with respect to the use of this feature.

The purpose of the Attestation is to protect the privacy and security of health plan members’ (hereinafter referred to as “Members") personal health information and ensure that Health Data Transfer uses Patients’ personal health information (PHI) responsibly if granted access to the Patient Access API provided by Smile CDR.

By attesting to the Attestation, the Member acknowledges that the Attestation is legally binding, and non-compliance may incur action from the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) or other government agencies to enforce these commitments and the rights of Patients in the United States.

The Attestation will pass to the benefit of and be binding upon the respective heirs, executors, administrators, successors, and permitted assigns of the Member.

Attestation

I attest to the following statements as applicable to the App:

  1. I authorize access and transfer my Personal Health Information on my behalf.
  2. I understand the purpose for disclosing this personal health information to the customer.
  3. I have read and agreed to the affirmatively shared privacy policy that includes and describes, at a minimum, the following important information:
  • How a Member's health information may be accessed, exchanged, or used by any person or other entity, including whether the Patient's health information may be shared or sold at any time (including in the future);
  • A requirement for express consent from a Member before the Patient's health information is accessed, exchanged, or used, including receiving express consent before a Patient's health information is shared or sold (other than disclosures required by law or disclosures necessary in connection with the sale of the application or a similar transaction);
  • How a Member can revoke consent for access to their data.

The term “affirmatively shared’ is defined as a Patient who has taken action to indicate they saw the App’s privacy policy, such as a click or checked one more box.

| have read and affirmatively attest to the Attestation.

MODAL.SHARE_WARNING_DESCRIPTION: I understand that, under HIPAA, the Plan may communicate with my adult family members, friends, or other persons who are involved in my health care or payment for health care.  By clicking here and consenting to have another person have access to my information on the portal, I am confirming that this person is a person involved in my health care or payment for health care and that I understand that this person will therefore have access to my information on the portal unless and until (a) I revoke that consent; or (b) I attain age 18 (if I am under age 18).
MODAL.REVOKE_WARNING_DESCRIPTION: I understand that, under HIPAA, the Plan may communicate with my adult family members, friends, or other persons who are involved in my health care or payment for health care, and I have previously consented to have another person (chosen by me) have access to my information on the portal.  I now hereby revoke that consent, effective immediately and starting from the date this revocation is processed by the Plan.  I understand that this person will no longer have access to my information on the portal unless and until I provide future access to them.

TOOLTIP.CLAIMS_DETAILS: A detailed summary of health care services received. EOB's also contain remarks to help understand how charges were processed.
TOOLTIP.LABS:
In this section you can view results from lab work ordered by your provider and billed to the Plan.

Note: Lab data is updated bi-weekly.
TOOLTIP.MEDICAL_HISTORY:
The ability to create your own Personal Health Notes (PHN) allows you, the individual, to create a complete health record, which can be easily accessed and updated as needed. Your Personal Health Notes is created and controlled by you. Your PHN can include information that your doctor may not have, such as dietary and exercise habits or daily records of glucose or blood pressure readings.

By creating a PHN, you can:

• Create an accurate and comprehensive record.
• Easily access and update health information at anytime, even while traveling.
• Provide information to a new healthcare provider.
• Keep a record in a secure environment and control access.
• Keep a complete health record in one place.
• Easily download or print the information as needed using the Blue Button feature.

Creating your own PHN is optional and not required by the Plan. If you decide to create a PHN, the information contained within is not reviewed by the Plan or shared to any other group or individual. The information contained within is not in any way associated with or used to determine benefits, coverage, or premiums.

Your PHN record is your personalized health record and contains a wide array of information for each member. Your PHN may contain medical information or results from health care services that do not represent a covered service or benefit of the NALC Plan. One such example would be collecting or claim services for information related to routine blood typing tests. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Group and Employees provides this PHN tool to assist its members in managing their healthcare records, regardless of the Plan benefit coverage being provided. Please refer to the current NALC Health Benefit Plan for Group and Employees brochure for information regarding the Plan's covered benefits or contact the Plan at (703)729-4677 or 1-888-636-6252.
TOOLTIP.YTD_BENEFITS: See at a glance how much of the annual deductible and catastrophic protection out-of- pocket maximum has been met by you and your family. The deductible is a fixed amount of covered expenses you must incur before we start paying certain benefits. Once the catastrophic protection out-of-pocket maximum is met for the year, we pay 100% of the Plan allowance for the remainder of the calendar year.

TOOLTIP.MEMBER_SEARCH:
Search the members using their First Name, Last Name or Member ID. Characters such as  # & "  are not allowed. Enter at least 3 or more characters before searching to reduce load time.  One field can be used, or several to narrow the search. Partial search terms for the member’s name can be matched. This function searches both the Smile CDR repository for member records and cross-references those records with the Azure AD B2C identity directory. For each member record, there is a menu of administrative activities that can be performed to support the member.

When members register for a portal account, three components manage the authentication process:
• A unique username
• A password
• An email address, used only for verification during registration and resetting lost passwords

Of these three, the only self-service option for the user is resetting passwords. For lost credentials, portal admins may need to assist users in recovering or resetting those credentials. These activities are currently carried out in the Azure AD B2C portal itself, accessible from Azure AD button on the top right.
TOOLTIP.ADMIN_SEARCH: Here you can manage the group of administrators and see their roles. Contact your super admin to edit your credentials/make changes to your roles and permissions.
TOOLTIP.MY_BENEFITS_PREVIEW: Download or print for an electronic version of the card. If you prefer to order duplicates of the plastic cards, new car...

consent_verbiage.body:
As a member, I have access to records for dependents under age 12 by default.

Members have implicit consent to access the records for dependents under age 12 by default, unless otherwise specified. At the age of 12, the implicit consent expires and access to minor’s records are removed until consent is re-established.

Members are able to update the minor dependents’ self-reported note medical history, and can grant consent to share the minor’s record with other adult dependents on the plan.

As a member / adult dependent (18+), I have access to records for dependents that turn 12 after contacting NALC to establish authorization.

There is a gap between the minimum age for a mature minor (12) and the age a minor can register an online account (13).

As an adult dependent over 18 years of age, I do not have access to records for dependents under age 12 by default.

Members are able to grant another adult dependent access to a minor dependent’s (under age 12) record through the ‘Share Preferences’ section within the ‘Account Settings’ of Member Portal.

Any user ages 13 and over can create an account.

As per the Child Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA), account registration of the NALC Member Portal is restricted for children under 13 years of age.

As a mature minor ages 13 and over, I can grant access to my health records to any adult on my plan.

Mature minors (13 and older) will be able to create accounts and access the consent preferences screen to delegate access to any adult member on the plan. As long as the individual is declaring that the information is being shared for the purpose of participating in their health care, a formal HIPAA authorization form would not be required. Any consent granted prior to age 18 would expire when the minor turns 18. Any subsequent sharing of records would require the user to reset their consent preference.

As a member, I do not have access to other dependents’ records by default (dependents over age 12).

As a spouse / dependent, I do not have access to member's, or other dependent’s records by default.

As a member, I have the option to grant or remove access to my records to any other adult (18+) on the member's plan.

As a dependent who is eligible to make an account (13 years and over), I can give or remove access to my records to any other adult (18+) on the member's plan through the portal.

As a member, I can see a list of people on the plan who currently have access to my records.

As a member / dependent, I am able to download data of the personal records I am able to view.

tos_privacy.body:
Privacy Policy

NALC Health Benefit Plan (the “Plan,” “us”, “we” or “our”) operates https://www.nalchbp.org/ (the “site”) and your privacy is important to us. The majority of this website is available only to registered users for the member’s portal. To become a registered user, NALC Health Benefit Plan participants and beneficiaries must complete the application form provided on this site. We are providing this notice in order to describe the site's online information collection and use practices. This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) applies only the information collected on this site, mobile applications, and any website or service that links to or refers to this Privacy Policy and not to any other information that the NALC Health Benefit Plan collects about you in other forums, including e-mail correspondence and via telephone.

Consent to Use NALC Health Benefit Plan

By becoming a registered user, you are consenting to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with the practices described in this Privacy Policy, please do not register as a user.

Using “Cookies” and Other Technologies to Monitor Website Usage

In order to make the site as user-friendly and informative as possible, your usage of the site will be monitored and recorded via the use of a “cookie.” A cookie is a piece of data that a website can send to your computer. A cookie is not a computer program; it cannot read data from your computer or embed any commands in your computer. While cookies can, and are used to, identify repeat visitors to a website, they do not contain any personal identifying information such as your email address, user ID, or password. Cookies cannot gather any personal information about you other than information you provide voluntarily, such as if you choose to register on the site.

The NALC Health Benefit Plan uses cookies to ensure security. By examining cookies during a visit, the website can verify that the user requesting an action is still the same user who logged on to the site. Cookies also keep track of aggregate statistics for a website, such as the total number of visitors to the site, the server location from which each visitor accesses the site, and the number of pages each visitor views. The NALC Health Benefit Plan collects this information, but never sells or enters into any arrangement to provide this information to a third party. The NALC Health Benefit Plan uses this information internally as a tool to improve the quality of the information and services offered through the site.

Most browser programs can be set to alert you when a website sends a cookie to your computer. Most browsers also provide a way for you to remove cookies from your computer. If you tell your browser to deny cookies while visiting this site, some of the features or services of our website may not function properly.

Your IP address is a number that is automatically assigned to the computer that you are using by your Internet Service Provider. An IP address may be identified and logged automatically in our Web server log files whenever a user accesses the site, along with the time of the visit and the page(s) that were visited. Collecting IP addresses is standard practice and is done automatically by many websites, applications and other services. We use IP addresses for purposes such as calculating usage levels of the site, helping diagnose server problems, and administering the site.

What Information is Collected

Such information may include your registration information, such as, full name, telephone number, e-mail address, postal address, racial or ethnic origin, certain account numbers, the User ID you create or is assigned to you, and other information described in this Privacy Policy.

We may use any email address you provide to send you periodic information and updates from the NALC Health Benefit Plan and from delegated third party partners and/or providers for the purpose of providing you and your family’s health care benefits, but we will never provide or sell your contact information to another party unless required or permitted by law.

We may also disclose your personal information and/or registration information with your permission or as directed or authorized by you.

How Information Collected is Used

The NALC Health Benefit Plan can only use the information it receives about you and your family for specific purposes, including, but not limited to:

  • Making payments to doctors, hospitals, and other health care professionals for the treatment and services that you and/or your dependents receive (i.e., processing claims);
  • Performing certain health care and health related services to help you and your dependents manage your health;
  • To comply with applicable laws, regulations, and legal process;
  • As otherwise necessary or useful for us in administering and operating the Plan, so long as such use is permitted by law or for any other purpose with your consent;
  • To provide technical support for the site; and
  • To perform analysis regarding how you use the site.

Privacy of Protected Health Information

Personal information that is unique to you, and can be used to identify you, may be considered protected health information under the terms of Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ('HIPAA') and is subject to the terms described in the HIPAA Notice of Privacy Practices available on this site. Please click here to view our Notice of Privacy Practices, for additional information, which is incorporated herein by reference.

Your Responsibility

By establishing registering as a user, you agree that you are ultimately responsible to:

Authorize, monitor, and control access to and use of your account, User ID and password.

Promptly inform us of any need to deactivate a password or an account by calling Customer Service at 1-888-636-NALC (6252) between the hours of 8:00am and 3:30pm Eastern Standard Time, Monday through Friday, except holidays.

Online Privacy Notice for Young Children

This site is not directed to nor intended for children under age 13, unless an exception is granted by the Plan. The NALC Health Benefit Plan does not knowingly collect information from children under the age of 13. You can visit the Federal Trade Commission’s website to learn about the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA).

In using this site, you affirm that you are age 13 or older and are fully able and competent to enter into the terms, conditions, obligations, affirmations, representations, and warranties set forth in this Privacy Policy, and to abide by and comply with this Privacy Policy.

Information Transmission

All personal information you provide is protected and encrypted before being transmitted to us. Once transmitted to us, information is stored on secure servers.

Specific inquiries about the site's Privacy Policy should be directed in writing to:

Privacy Official

NALC Health Benefit Plan

P O Box 678

Ashburn, VA 20146

*Be sure to include the member's name and identification number as it appears on your ID card.

Changes

We may change this Policy at any time. If we do so, such change will appear on this page. We will also provide notice and choices to you, on this website and in other appropriate locations, based on the scope and extent of changes. You may always visit this Policy to learn of any updates. Your continued access to or use of this account constitutes your consent to these changes to this Policy.

Terms and Conditions of Website Use

By accessing or using this online portal and website, mobile application, or other electronic or web-based services (including the chat services) from the NALC Health Benefit Plan, you acknowledge that you have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of use set forth herein, and that you will comply with all applicable laws and regulations. The NALC Health Benefit Plan may update these terms and conditions at any time, without prior notice, by updating this site.

No Warranties

The NALC Health Benefit Plan will endeavor to keep all information that it posts on this site as accurate and current as possible. However, due to the possibility of error, the NALC Health Benefit Plan will not make, and hereby disclaims, any expressed or implied warranty of any kind with respect to the contents of this site, including, but not limited to, any representation with respect to such information's accuracy, completeness, or appropriateness for a particular purpose. Note that some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion of implied warranties.

Any mention of specific products or services on this site does not constitute or imply a recommendation or endorsement by the NALC Health Benefit Plan, unless specifically stated.

No Liabilities

The NALC Health Benefit Plan will not be liable for any delay, difficulty in use, inaccuracy or incompleteness of information, computer viruses, malicious code, loss of data, or compatibility issues, even if someone has advised us of the possibility of such damages or loss, and/or has informed us of a problem with the site or its content. You use the site at your own risk. The NALC Health Benefit Plan is not liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of your access to our site, or any link we provide to another site. In no event will the NALC Health Benefit Plan be liable to you or to anyone else for any decision made or action taken by you or anyone else in reliance on results or files that are obtained or downloaded from this site. As a user of this site, you assume full responsibility with respect to your use of posted information, and you understand that the NALC Health Benefit Plan is neither responsible nor liable for any claim, loss or damages resulting from such use. You agree to use this site on “As Is” or “As Available” basis.

Informational Purposes Only

The NALC Health Benefit Plan provides the information on this site for informational purposes only. You should not construe this information as an offer of medical services or as advice on medical treatments. Any information presented on this site is general in nature and may not contain all the conditions, limitations, or exclusions necessary to describe a product or service. The information provided on this site is not a substitute for professional health care. Consult a physician or other licensed health care professional before making any health-related decisions. If you have a medical emergency, call 911.

Links to Other Sites

This website may provide links or references to other sites. The information on such other sites may be inaccurate or incomplete. The NALC Health Benefit Plan neither bears any responsibility for the content of other sites nor makes any representations or warranties with respect to any information on other sites. The NALC Health Benefit Plan shall not be held liable for any damages or injuries arising from the contents of other sites. If such a website is operated by NALC Health Benefit Plan, it will be subject to our Privacy Policy and these terms and conditions.

The NALC Health Benefit Plan does not endorse any of the companies or products which are posted on sites to which this site has provided links, or which are posted on sites that provide links to this site. Links to other sites are provided merely as a convenience to users. Because some links or references may link you to other sites containing information that may be deemed inappropriate or offensive, we cannot be held responsible for the accuracy, copyright compliance, legality, or decency of material contained in or made available by those resources, and you hereby irrevocably waive any claim against us with respect to such links or references. If you decide to access any of the sites linked to this website, you do so entirely at your own discretion and risk. The NALC Health Benefit Plan does not control such sites and therefore, is not responsible. The NALC Health Benefit Plan reserves the right to terminate any link at any time.

Specific inquiries about the site's Privacy Policy should be directed in writing to:

NALC Health Benefit Plan

P O Box 678

Ashburn, VA 20146

*Be sure to include the member's name and identification number as it appears on your ID card.

WEB TOOLS/ COST ESTIMATE TOOLS

Cost Estimates Are Only Estimates; Factors Considered For Cost Estimates. Cost estimates provided through this site are estimates only and are not a guarantee of the actual cost to you, or payment or benefits from the NALC Health Benefit Plan. The estimates are based on certain factors, potentially including contract rates, fee schedule, and/or claims averages. The average geographic cost estimates are based on average costs for in-network providers within the specific geographic market.

Your actual costs may be higher or lower than the estimate for various reasons, including but not limited to:

  • Application of copays, deductibles, and coinsurance amounts;
  • Your unique medical circumstances and the decisions made by you and your health care professionals as to what services you will receive; if the services you receive are different from the services in the care path, the cost estimates based on the care path may vary from the cost for the services you receive;
  • Where you receive services (for instance, if you receive services in a hospital and your estimate was based on services received in a healthcare provider's office or outpatient facility, the services may cost more than the estimate);
  • If you change plans or enter a new plan year between the time you get the estimate and when you actually receive health care services;
  • Even within a given plan year for a given benefit plan, your benefit plan information (such as your outstanding deductible or whether you have satisfied your out-of-pocket maximum) may be impacted by health care services you have already received but for which we have not yet received or processed a claim;
  • Changes in the fee schedule or coverage, if your cost estimate is specific to a particular specific health care facility or professional (generally, it is more expensive for you to receive services from non-network facilities or professionals than from those who participate in network).

Please note that other healthcare services may be provided to you that are medically necessary and appropriate as part of procedures for which you may have searched for an estimate, but of which you may not be aware at the time of your inquiry and for which you may have additional financial responsibility.

No Guarantee on Information Provided. You should refer to your coverage documents (Brochure) and contact the NALC Health Benefit Plan for details concerning your coverage, and you should contact your provider to confirm whether they are in-network. State, geographical, and area code variations may impact the estimates available through this site.

Costs Not Covered by the NALC Health Benefit Plan. You may be responsible for the cost of procedures or services, some of which may be covered in whole or in part or not at all by the NALC Health Benefit Plan. You should refer to the NALC Health Benefit Plan brochure or contact the NALC Health Benefit Plan to determine whether procedures, services, or medication are covered by the NALC Health Benefit Plan.

Restrictions

You agree that you shall not:

  1. Interrupt or disrupt or attempt to interrupt or disrupt the site in any way or prevent or impede any other party’s access to the site;
  2. Provide false or misleading information about yourself or others on or through the site;
  3. Post any User Content on or through the site that contains or delivers any form of viruses, trojan horses or any other form of malicious or harmful program;
  4. Modify or change or attempt to modify or change any aspect of the site;
  5. Collect or store personal data about other users on the site;
  6. Violate or attempt to violate any security features of the site, including, without limitation, accessing content or data not intended for you, or logging onto a server or account that you are not authorized to access;
  7. Attempt to probe, scan or test the vulnerability of the site, or any associated system or network, or to breach security or authentication measures without proper authorization;
  8. Interfere or attempt to interfere with service to any user, host or network, including, without limitation, by means of submitting a virus to the site, “overloading,” "flooding," "spamming," "mail bombing" or "crashing;"
  9. Use the site to send unsolicited e-mail, including, without limitation, promotions, or advertisements for products or services;
  10. Forge any TCP/IP packet header or any part of the header information in any e-mail or in any posting using the site; or
  11. Attempt to modify, reverse-engineer, decompile, disassemble or otherwise reduce or attempt to reduce to a human-perceivable form any of the source code used by the NALC Health Benefit Plan in providing the site.

Any violation of system or network security may subject you to civil and/or criminal liability.

MISCELLANEOUS

If any term or provision of these terms and conditions are for any reason held to be invalid, such invalidity shall not affect any other term or provision, and these terms and conditions shall be interpreted as if such term or provision had never been contained in these terms and conditions. No failure of NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff to exercise or enforce any right or provision contained herein shall constitute a waiver of that right or provision. All of the provisions of these terms and conditions shall survive the termination of these terms and conditions for any reason. These terms and conditions, your use of this site, and all related matters, regardless of your location, are governed solely by, and construed solely in accordance with, the laws of the United States and the State of Virginia, without giving effect to its conflict of law provisions.

Terms and Conditions of Website Use

By accessing or using this online portal and website, mobile application, or other electronic or web-based services (including the chat services) from the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff, you acknowledge that you have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of use set forth herein, and that you will comply with all applicable laws and regulations. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff may update these terms and conditions at any time, without prior notice, by updating this site.

No Warranties

The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff will endeavor to keep all information that it posts on this site as accurate and current as possible. However, due to the possibility of error, the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff will not make, and hereby disclaims, any expressed or implied warranty of any kind with respect to the contents of this site, including, but not limited to, any representation with respect to such information's accuracy, completeness, or appropriateness for a particular purpose. Note that some jurisdictions do not allow the exclusion of implied warranties.

Any mention of specific products or services on this site does not constitute or imply a recommendation or endorsement by the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff, unless specifically stated.

No Liabilities

The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff will not be liable for any delay, difficulty in use, inaccuracy or incompleteness of information, computer viruses, malicious code, loss of data, or compatibility issues, even if someone has advised us of the possibility of such damages or loss, and/or has informed us of a problem with the site or its content. You use the site at your own risk. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff is not liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of your access to our site, or any link we provide to another site. In no event will the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff be liable to you or to anyone else for any decision made or action taken by you or anyone else in reliance on results or files that are obtained or downloaded from this site. As a user of this site, you assume full responsibility with respect to your use of posted information, and you understand that the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff is neither responsible nor liable for any claim, loss or damages resulting from such use. You agree to use this site on “As Is” or “As Available” basis.

Informational Purposes Only

The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff provides the information on this site for informational purposes only. You should not construe this information as an offer of medical services or as advice on medical treatments. Any information presented on this site is general in nature, and may not contain all the conditions, limitations, or exclusions necessary to describe a product or service. The information provided on this site is not a substitute for professional health care. Consult a physician or other licensed health care professional before making any health-related decisions. If you have a medical emergency, call 911.

Links to Other Sites

This website may provide links or references to other sites. The information on such other sites may be inaccurate or incomplete. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff neither bears any responsibility for the content of other sites nor makes any representations or warranties with respect to any information on other sites. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff shall not be held liable for any damages or injuries arising from the contents of other sites. If such a website is operated by NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff, it will be subject to our Privacy Policy and these terms and conditions.

The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff does not endorse any of the companies or products which are posted on sites to which this site has provided links, or which are posted on sites that provide links to this site. Links to other sites are provided merely as a convenience to users. Because some links or references may link you to other sites containing information that may be deemed inappropriate or offensive, we cannot be held responsible for the accuracy, copyright compliance, legality, or decency of material contained in or made available by those resources, and you hereby irrevocably waive any claim against us with respect to such links or references. If you decide to access any of the sites linked to this website, you do so entirely at your own discretion and risk. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff does not control such sites and therefore, is not responsible. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff reserves the right to terminate any link at any time.

Specific inquiries about the site's Privacy Policy should be directed in writing to:

NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff

P O Box 678

Ashburn, VA 20146

*Be sure to include the member's name and identification number as it appears on your ID card.

WEB TOOLS/ COST ESTIMATE TOOLS

Cost Estimates Are Only Estimates; Factors Considered For Cost Estimates. Cost estimates provided through this site are estimates only and are not a guarantee of the actual cost to you, or payment or benefits from the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff. The estimates are based on certain factors, potentially including contract rates, fee schedule, and/or claims averages. The average geographic cost estimates are based on average costs for in-network providers within the specific geographic market.

Your actual costs may be higher or lower than the estimate for various reasons, including but not limited to:

  • Application of copays, deductibles, and coinsurance amounts;
  • Your unique medical circumstances and the decisions made by you and your health care professionals as to what services you will receive; if the services you receive are different from the services in the care path, the cost estimates based on the care path may vary from the cost for the services you receive;
  • Where you receive services (for instance, if you receive services in a hospital and your estimate was based on services received in a healthcare provider's office or outpatient facility, the services may cost more than the estimate);
  • If you change plans or enter a new plan year between the time you get the estimate and when you actually receive health care services;
  • Even within a given plan year for a given benefit plan, your benefit plan information (such as your outstanding deductible or whether you have satisfied your out-of-pocket maximum) may be impacted by health care services you have already received but for which we have not yet received or processed a claim;
  • Changes in the fee schedule or coverage, if your cost estimate is specific to a particular specific health care facility or professional (generally, it is more expensive for you to receive services from non-network facilities or professionals than from those who participate in network).

Please note that other healthcare services may be provided to you that are medically necessary and appropriate as part of procedures for which you may have searched for an estimate, but of which you may not be aware at the time of your inquiry and for which you may have additional financial responsibility.

No Guarantee on Information Provided. You should refer to your coverage documents (Brochure) and contact the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff for details concerning your coverage, and you should contact your provider to confirm whether they are in-network. State, geographical, and area code variations may impact the estimates available through this site.

Costs Not Covered by the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff. You may be responsible for the cost of procedures or services, some of which may be covered in whole or in part or not at all by the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff. You should refer to the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff brochure or contact the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff to determine whether procedures, services, or medication are covered by the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff.

Restrictions

You agree that you shall not:

  1. Interrupt or disrupt or attempt to interrupt or disrupt the site in any way or prevent or impede any other party’s access to the site;
  2. Provide false or misleading information about yourself or others on or through the site;
  3. Post any User Content on or through the site that contains or delivers any form of viruses, trojan horses or any other form of malicious or harmful program;
  4. Modify or change or attempt to modify or change any aspect of the site;
  5. Collect or store personal data about other users on the site;
  6. Violate or attempt to violate any security features of the site, including, without limitation, accessing content or data not intended for you, or logging onto a server or account that you are not authorized to access;
  7. Attempt to probe, scan or test the vulnerability of the site, or any associated system or network, or to breach security or authentication measures without proper authorization;
  8. Interfere or attempt to interfere with service to any user, host or network, including, without limitation, by means of submitting a virus to the site, overloading, "flooding," "spamming," "mail bombing" or "crashing;"
  9. Use the site to send unsolicited e-mail, including, without limitation, promotions, or advertisements for products or services;
  10. Forge any TCP/IP packet header or any part of the header information in any e-mail or in any posting using the site; or
  11. Attempt to modify, reverse-engineer, decompile, disassemble or otherwise reduce or attempt to reduce to a human-perceivable form any of the source code used by the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff in providing the site.

Any violation of system or network security may subject you to civil and/or criminal liability.

MISCELLANEOUS

If any term or provision of these terms and conditions are for any reason held to be invalid, such invalidity shall not affect any other term or provision, and these terms and conditions shall be interpreted as if such term or provision had never been contained in these terms and conditions. No failure of NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff to exercise or enforce any right or provision contained herein shall constitute a waiver of that right or provision. All of the provisions of these terms and conditions shall survive the termination of these terms and conditions for any reason. These terms and conditions, your use of this site, and all related matters, regardless of your location, are governed solely by, and construed solely in accordance with, the laws of the United States and the State of Virginia, without giving effect to its conflict of law provisions.

Privacy Policy

NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff (the “Plan,” “us”, “we” or “our”) operates https://staff.nalchbp.org/ (the “site”) and your privacy is important to us. The majority of this website is available only to registered users for the member’s portal. To become a registered user, NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff participants and beneficiaries must complete the application form provided on this site. We are providing this notice in order to describe the site's online information collection and use practices. This privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) applies only the information collected on this site, mobile applications, and any website or service that links to or refers to this Privacy Policy and not to any other information that the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff collects about you in other forums, including e-mail correspondence and via telephone.

Consent to Use NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff’s Portal

By becoming a registered user, you are consenting to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree with the practices described in this Privacy Policy, please do not register as a user.

Using “Cookies” and Other Technologies to Monitor Website Usage

In order to make the site as user-friendly and informative as possible, your usage of the site will be monitored and recorded via the use of a “cookie.” A cookie is a piece of data that a website can send to your computer. A cookie is not a computer program; it cannot read data from your computer or embed any commands in your computer. While cookies can, and are used to, identify repeat visitors to a website, they do not contain any personal identifying information such as your email address, user ID, or password. Cookies cannot gather any personal information about you other than information you provide voluntarily, such as if you choose to register on the site.

The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff uses cookies to ensure security. By examining cookies during a visit, the website can verify that the user requesting an action is still the same user who logged on to the site. Cookies also keep track of aggregate statistics for a website, such as the total number of visitors to the site, the server location from which each visitor accesses the site, and the number of pages each visitor views. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff collects this information, but never sells or enters into any arrangement to provide this information to a third party. The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff uses this information internally as a tool to improve the quality of the information and services offered through the site.

Most browser programs can be set to alert you when a website sends a cookie to your computer. Most browsers also provide a way for you to remove cookies from your computer. If you tell your browser to deny cookies while visiting this site, some of the features or services of our website may not function properly.

Your IP address is a number that is automatically assigned to the computer that you are using by your Internet Service Provider. An IP address may be identified and logged automatically in our Web server log files whenever a user accesses the site, along with the time of the visit and the page(s) that were visited. Collecting IP addresses is standard practice and is done automatically by many websites, applications and other services. We use IP addresses for purposes such as calculating usage levels of the site, helping diagnose server problems, and administering the site.

What Information is Collected

Such information may include your registration information, such as, full name, telephone number, e-mail address, postal address, racial or ethnic origin, certain account numbers, the User ID you create or is assigned to you, and other information described in this Privacy Policy.

We may use any email address you provide to send you periodic information and updates from the NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff and from delegated third party partners and/or providers for the purpose of providing you and your family’s health care benefits, but we will never provide or sell your contact information to another party unless required or permitted by law.

We may also disclose your personal information and/or registration information with your permission or as directed or authorized by you.

How Information Collected is Used

The NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff can only use the information it receives about you and your family for specific purposes, including, but not limited to:

  • Making payments to doctors, hospitals, and other health care professionals for the treatment and services that you and/or your dependents receive (i.e., processing claims);
  • Performing certain health care and health related services to help you and your dependents manage your health;
  • To comply with applicable laws, regulations, and legal process;
  • As otherwise necessary or useful for us in administering and operating the Plan, so long as such use is permitted by law or for any other purpose with your consent;
  • To provide technical support for the site; and
  • To perform analysis regarding how you use the site.

Privacy of Protected Health Information

Personal information that is unique to you, and can be used to identify you, may be considered protected health information under the terms of Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ('HIPAA') and is subject to the terms described in the HIPAA Notice of Privacy Practices available on this site. Please click here to view our Notice of Privacy Practices, for additional information, which is incorporated herein by reference.

Your Responsibility

By establishing registering as a user, you agree that you are ultimately responsible to:

Authorize, monitor, and control access to and use of your account, User ID and password.

Promptly inform us of any need to deactivate a password or an account by calling Customer Service at 1-888-636-NALC (6252) between the hours of 8:00am and 3:30pm Eastern Standard Time, Monday through Friday, except holidays.

Online Privacy Notice for Young Children

This site is not directed to nor intended for children under age 13, unless an exception is granted by the Plan. The NALC Health Benefit Plan does not knowingly collect information from children under the age of 13. You can visit the Federal Trade Commission’s website to learn about the Children’s Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA).

In using this site, you affirm that you are age 13 or older and are fully able and competent to enter into the terms, conditions, obligations, affirmations, representations, and warranties set forth in this Privacy Policy, and to abide by and comply with this Privacy Policy.

Information Transmission

All personal information you provide is protected and encrypted before being transmitted to us. Once transmitted to us, information is stored on secure servers.

Specific inquiries about the site's Privacy Policy should be directed in writing to:

Privacy Official

NALC Health Benefit Plan for Employees and Staff

P O Box 678

Ashburn, VA 20146

*Be sure to include the member's name and identification number as it appears on your ID card.

Changes

We may change this Policy at any time. If we do so, such change will appear on this page. We will also provide notice and choices to you, on this website and in other appropriate locations, based on the scope and extent of changes. You may always visit this Policy to learn of any updates. Your continued access to or use of this account constitutes your consent to these changes to this Policy.

provider_cards.body: A primary care physician practices general healthcare, addressing a wide variety of health concerns for patients. They are typically the first person you talk to if you have a health concern. Find a primary care practitioner!
provider_cards.title: Primary Care Practitioners

provider_cards.body: A health facility is, in general, any location where healthcare is provided. Health facilities range from small clinics and doctor's offices to urgent care centers and large hospitals with elaborate emergency rooms and trauma centers.
provider_cards.title: Facilities

Customer Service Lines

 

Whether your needs are for general information or specific medical and claims questions, the NALC Plan is here for you!

For us to service your call better, please have your Plan ID number and claimant information readily available when you place your call.   

Monday thru Friday 8:00 a.m. - 3:30 p.m.
Eastern Standard Time (EST)

 

Health Benefit Plan 1-703-729-4677
Customer Service 1-888-636-6252
Durable Medical Equipment 1-888-636-6252
Fraud Hot Line 1-888-636-6252
Smoking Cessation Program 1-866-784-8454



Sunday thru Friday 8 a.m. - 3 a.m. EST

Saturday 9 a.m. - 12 a.m. EST
Weight Management Program 1-855-948-8255

 

Monday thru Friday, EST
PPO Locator Service 1-877-220-6252
Inpatient Hospital Precertification 1-877-220-6252
8 a.m. - 8 p.m.
Outpatient Radiology/
Imaging Services Precertification
Spinal Surgery Precertification 

1-877-220-6252
8 a.m. - 8 p.m.

8 a.m. - 5 p.m.
Cigna LIFESOURCE Transplant Program 1-800-668-9682
8 a.m. - 6 p.m.

 

7 days a week, 24 hours a day
Prescription Drug Program 1-800-933-NALC

 

Monday thru Saturday, 7:30 a.m. to 9 p.m., EST

CVS/Specialty Pharmacy

1-800-237-2767

 

7 days a week, 24 hours a day
OptumHealth Behavioral Solutions 1-877-468-1016

 

 

Call the NALC Consumer Driven Plan or Value Option Plan

  • For more information about the NALC Health Benefit CDHP and Value Option or to locate a CDHP or Value Option Cigna HealthCare OAP network provider, please call Cigna HealthCare at 1-855-511-1893.
  • Questions regarding prescription drugs? Please call CVS Caremark for the NALC Health Benefit CDHP and Value Option Plans at 1-800-933-NALC (6252) 24 hours-a-day, 7 days-a-week.

NALC Health Benefit Plan
20547 Waverly Court
Ashburn, VA 20149
customcontent.title: Contact Us

customcontent.text:
Common questions and answers:

 

1. I have a problem with one of my claims, what do I do?

A: Please contact us and we will help you sort it out.

 

2. Where can I find details about available plans?

A: Please visit our website at nalchbp.org for details on all our plans

 

3. When downloading a file on the Android app, I'm getting an error message that has "An error occurred. Please try again. Please enable storage permissions. For more information please check our FAQs page." How do I do this?

A: Here are the steps to reset the app's download permissions: 
    1. Tap and hold the NALCHBP Member Portal app icon until a pop up box appears
    2. Tap app info
    3. Tap permissions
    4. Tap storage
    5. Tap the circle next to Deny and then tap the circle next to Allow
    6. Go back into the portal and download the file again
customcontent.title: FAQ

mybenefits.html_content:
High Option Plan – a nationwide Fee-for-Service plan aligned with two (2) preferred provider organization (PPO) networks —Cigna for medical and hospital and Optum for behavioral health. Our prescription drug retail network and mail order pharmacy are through CVS Caremark®. The High Option offers low out of pocket costs for medical and mental health services and prescription medications, no doctor referrals required, and 100% coverage for recommended preventative care services. This Plan offers the best value for your healthcare dollar and an exceptional benefits package. If Medicare is your primary insurance, you pay no out of pocket expenses for services that Medicare covers. Click here for more details.

CDHP – a nationwide consumer driven health plan aligned with the Cigna preferred provider organization (PPO) network for medical, hospital and behavioral health. Our prescription drug retail network and mail order pharmacy are through CVS Caremark®. Consumer driven plans focus on the health care consumer and give you greater control in how you use your health care benefits. Unlike the High Option Plan, the CDHP has a higher deductible amount and includes a Personal Care Account (funded by the Plan) that is used to offset your out-of-pocket costs. Click here for more details.

Value Option - a nationwide consumer driven health plan aligned with the Cigna preferred provider organization (PPO) network for medical, hospital and behavioral health. Our prescription drug retail network and mail order pharmacy are through CVS Caremark®. Consumer driven plans focus on the health care consumer and give you greater control in how you use your health care benefits. Unlike the High Option Plan, the Value Option plan has a higher deductible amount and includes a Personal Care Account (funded by the Plan and a lesser amount than the CDHP) that is used to offset your out-of-pocket costs. Click here for more details.
